title: 112_hr2867
content:
The Act titled "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011" establishes terms of office for Commission members, limiting them to 2 terms of 2 years each. The Act limits Commission members to two terms of two years each, with a provision that if a member completes at least 2 full terms, their term expires 90 days after. Members attending less than 75% of meetings in one term are ineligible for reappointment. Additionally, no member can serve as Chair for a second consecutive term. Members of the Commission are subject to federal travel regulations and Department of State standardized regulations. SEC. 3. APPLICATION OF ANTIDISCRIMINATION LAWS.
    Section 204 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include protections against employment discrimination, fair labor standards, employee rights, and protections for workers whose pay is disbursed by the Secretary of the Senate. SEC. 3 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include protections against employment discrimination, fair labor standards, and employee rights for workers whose pay is disbursed by the Secretary of the Senate or the Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives. The Commission employees will be treated as employees of the Senate or House of Representatives. Any pending claims can be maintained under section 204(g) of the Act. Additionally, SEC. 4 authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2012 through 2014. SEC. 5 amends Section 208 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 by increasing the monetary limit and changing a subsection title. SEC. 6 changes the termination date of the Act. SEC. 7 requires a report on the effectiveness of programs promoting religious freedom. The Comptroller General will submit a report on the implementation and effectiveness of US programs promoting international religious freedom, including assessing the Office on International Religious Freedom's roles and functions. The curr_chunk discusses the review and assessment of various aspects related to international religious freedom, including the roles of the Ambassador at Large, the goals of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, and a comparative analysis of its structure. The curr_chunk discusses the relationship between the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom, and potential reforms to enhance their effectiveness. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in this section. The curr_chunk discusses the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
